reviews.review_msg: Most of your grade depends on revisions and improvements (and this course isn't curved). Christian will provide you with very detailed feedback; if you meet with him or TAs via office hours, you will be very likely to succeed. I recommend putting in the effort to improve your communication skills through this course- it'll pay off in the long run.

Christian seems like a nice guy tbh. If you go to his office hours he will provide you with good feedback on how to improve your writing. Unfortunately, 40% of your mark is from the group project (outline+ppt+presentation) so it's difficult to get a good mark, especially since the class isn't curved.

He is super difficult but you will learn a lot. I was super stressed during the semester and was praying for his downfall, but looking back, I gained a lot from his high expectations. Just be ready to spend a lot of time on assignments and don't worry too much about individual grades, he notices improvement. Just go to office hours it helps

Christian is an amazing professor who is really serious about the material. Participation really matters in this class. However Christian is a really tough grader and if you don't have proficient writing skills then you should attend his office hours more often to get more feedback otherwise you will most likely struggle in this class.

critical thinking skills are the infrastructure of your professionalism in the workplace, BUS 360W will help you to demonstrate your practical and critical thinking skills through your business writing. You will improve your ability to conceptualize, analyze / evaluate, synthesize, and apply information to guide both your thinking and your writ

I cruise controlled my way through the course, a mistake I want all readers to know not to make! For your sanity, go to office hours right after BM#1; it will relieve future stress.

Christian is a great lecturer and an expert in communication who gave honest feedback (direct, no BS, like sour medicine, won't like it, but it's good for you).

No regrets about taking this course with him. Encourages the use of office hours and other writing resources, and is very critical in marking and feedback. Emphasizes how this course is graded based on your improvement, and wants you to try your hardest to show your progress through the course. Lectures are very engaging and informative.

Christian is an overall great teacher but in order to do well in the course, it requires PARTICIPATION. This includes prereading materials before class, taking notes, paying attention to assignments and course guidelines, and CONSTANT improvement. Do not go into the course expecting it to be easy. Use office hours whenever possible.
Nice guy and teaches well. Just a hard course as its not curved.

Took BUS 201 and BUS 360 with Christian. One of the best professors at Beedie. I always look forward to going to his lectures because they are so engaging. He genuinely cares about the learning of his students, and you will learn a lot. If you follow his advice, follow the instruction, and go to office hours, you will get a good grade.
Nice guy but he's so full of himself and schedules presentations outside of class hours. Unless you want to risk presenting on a weekend in the evening I'd see who else is available.

Christian does an excellent job at helping students stay engaged during class. His lectures are entertaining, and informative. He's a tough grader and provides lots of feedback, but all 360 profs are like this; so it should not be a surprise. Lots of group work for the class also. I would recommend Christian if you want to get something out of 360!

Christian has very high standards for his students. He is very passionate and brings a lot of value to his students if you go to office hours and applying feedback. Workload is heavy but expected for a 4-credit course. If you want an easy A, not the best prof to take it with.

Take this advice before you regret it. DON'T take Christian thinking you can easily pass his course. Went in having hopes, ended the semester totally burnt out. Comments and feedback provided are his opinions. Egotistical.
Avoid at all costs. Poor lecture quality, insanely tough grader, and does not help at all during office hours.

A very very very tough grader. "International students" should not take him! No help during his office hour because he won't tell you specifically about your questions, so you still didn't know what to do. No recommendation!

Christian is a strict grader but all BUS360 profs are, at least Christian clearly communicates his reasonable expectations. He cares a lot about his students and likes to engage with them. Lectures are fun and he tries to make them as engaging as possible. Overall an amazing prof, but not an easy class.
360 is a hard class so don't blame him for the tough marking, he really cares about his students and wants them to develop skills that will be useful in the real world.

Christian is a caring prof but his courses are really tough and this is way too hard for me. Its a very practical course. But please, DO NOT JUST TAKE THE WORD from someone who got an A level in this course. THINK TWICE before going with Christian.

I loved taking this class with Christian. He wants to see each of the his students succeed and cares about everyone. A large part of the course depends on your group so take the time and give well thought out answers for the personal survey as this is how he chooses the groups. Stay on top of the assignments and see him in office hours.

Definitely enjoyed my experience in this class. Christian is a dedicated professional and one of the best profs I have had at Beedie. The course is hard but your grade is predicated on your own improvement, and the resources are there in order to get better and score higher. 100% recommend taking this course with Christian.

This prof goes above and beyond for students. Tough class but no better person to take it with. This was his announcement during COVID-19 "If you need food to get you through a few days, let me know what you need and where & when I can drop it off. No questions asked; no need for discussion or repayment". Really shows what kind of person he is.
He is a super tough grader. If you wanna get the lowest mark you could ever get in this course, go ahead and take with this gUy.

Do not take him unless you have ample amount of free time to do revisions and use office hours twice a week. He has crazy standards and sometimes not really effective. For example, you are not allowed to say "I/My/Me/We" on any assignments  because it is not "You-view." That does not make sense to me at all.

Hilarious and personable. The course isn't as hard as people make it out to be, but it does require some effort. Go see Christian and the TA for feedback, apply it, repeat. They want you to improve and tell you how. Office hour slots fill up fast.
This class aint no joke fam
Great professor! Cares about students, relates class to real life. He gives a lot of feedback, and fills your assignment with red ink, but it is only so that you can improve.

BUS360 is a demanding course and requires sufficient time for assignments. Christian provides direct feedback on deliverables, which can help you bump up your grades on subsequent assignments. Start early and do revisions for assignments and you will do fine.  Go to office hours with specific questions for more help!
Not very helpful and biased. BUS 360W is not curved, so you're better off taking it with a different prof.

Honestly speaking, Christian is fair. In the work place, people are too tired to provide any feedback at all. Having said that, getting an A in his class does require a good command of the English language.

He rarely worked outside school and often says "in the real world...". He recommends students go to Study Comments after he agreed "they are not very helpful" outside class. He emphasize on not grading for "effort", but he give (75%) students only 8mins a week on a 22% assignment, and says he's done more than enough. 25% don't get to see him.

Painful memory... I almost failed the course when I first took it with him, but then I received an A- when I retook it with another prof. Guess the grade difference explains something about him.   One last thing: ESL students, avoid him if you want an easier life.

Avoid him if you don't want to dump your GPA. BUS 360 is hard itself but Christian actually makes it harder. No presentation for his class (there is an easy 10% worth presentation for other BUS 360 classes) means that you have to write more and suffer more. If you are not quite confident with your writing, then his class will be a nightmare.

Christian is a great professor who cares a lot about his students. You have to work hard and use his feedback (tough as it may be sometimes). If you choose not to, you won't enjoy 360.  Always remember that he's only being harsh because he wants to ensure you improve as much as possible. Good luck!

Despite what all the other ratings say, Christian really does want his students to do well. Be willing to put in the effort, and do exactly what the corrections say! Most of the marks are from revisions, so follow his suggestions and you'll do well. Since this is a writing course, you need to have a good understanding of the English language.

This course was way easier than I had expected. Follow his guidelines  carefully, visit his office hours for revisions, and take this course seriously. If you do just that, you will easily get a B+A-. However, if your grammatical skills are weak, don't expect to get higher than a C+.

Reasons why you should avoid this prof at all cost: 1. He intentionally puts people with bad writings into one team. (PE#3) 2. He is an extremely tough grader comparing to some of the easy profs like Eric and others 3. People got good marks in his class claimed he is hard but useful. However, 360 in general is useful, Eric etc. gives same result

The course content was useful but the prof. was bad. For non-native English speakers, he assumed that they lack English skills and purposely tried to fail them by grading HARD on them. His office hours were useless, as all he did was criticizing your mistakes instead of giving any feedback:"What do you think? You should know it already." Avoid Him!

Ridiculous class. Professor will provide feedback that attacks you as a writer rather than being constructive (thank god for the excellent TAs). Expects a ridiculous amount of adhering to his formulas; which is the only way to receive even a some-what decent grade in this class. Do not take this class with this professor.

The course itself was helpful, but the professor was like a girl on her period. Picks at the smallest, and useless stuff. Gets mad every time you make a small mistake. Not very clear and not very helpful. Office hours with him was useless. I ended up getting help from the TA instead.
I wish him well.

Christian is one of the best professors I have had at SFU. His lectures are easy to understand and he always does his best to keep things interesting. His expectations are crystal clear, which makes it possible to do very well in his class. I found him to be a fair marker and would definitely recommend him for BUS 360W.

Christian is one of the best professors I have ever had: helpful, hilarious, clear and dedicated. The class was a lot of work, but it was not very hard (in my opinion). If you are not good with correct usage of the English language, and the basic concepts of grammar trip you up, you will NOT have fun in this course. Good luck!
Greatest 360 Prof out there! Tough class, but he makes things very clear.

This course is the most anal course in your BBA career. Yes, it'll be helpful, but the process is very painful. Do EXACTLY as you're instructed to; any less or more and you won't be getting a good grade. Start VERY EARLY on EVERYTHING. I'm 200% sure last minute work will KILL you, especially REVISIONS! Aside from that, Christian is nice, but tough.
He's nice but the marking is pretty brutal. Both him and especially the TA will find something wrong with your paper/assignments even if it is perfectly written. Lot of work.

He's an excellent and friendly professor. The course itself is very hard, as all BUS360 courses are,but it helps to have a good prof as Venhuizen. He keeps things interesting with lots of stories. You really have to work hard in this course, no slacking, and practice! practice! practice! on your writing.

Insanely tough grader but gives good feedback so that you can do well in second submission. But the group project is worth a lot and for that there is only so much you can do if your group members don't put in the work. The Q&A for the final presentation was super hard. Oh and he doesn't use canvas which is insane.

Super nit-picky about all the small stuff, one mistake often leads to 0/X on the related rubric item.

Final project requires you to spend $15-$20 on paraphernalia and postage for the encasing of your final portfolio assignment, just for him to mail it back to you. 

No canvas, which is crazy for the tuition we pay.
Very suspicious man. Can't put my finger on it but something doesn't sit right 🤔

Overall, it was a tough course, but Kevin tells you everything he expects. Try to follow his guidelines and textbook as closely as possible, and during revision, follow exactly what the feedback says. Ask clarifying questions until you understand; you will do fine with Kevin!

Kevin is a great professor, the course is difficult but he really does everything he can to ensure you succeed. The course is set up to learn from your mistakes and capitalize on great feedback. Plus he makes a good textbook.

Kevin is one of the best profs that I've had when it comes to lectures, he has a great presentation style and is knowledgable about what he is teaching. 360 is a tough class in general, but I would highly recommend taking it with Kevin as the feedback he gives is very clear which allows you to do better on the future assignments
Kevin was an amazing Professor who prepared you for the real world. Although he does not use Canvas, printing and submitting the documents in person was different, yet enjoyable.

I can confirm that he's a nice professor and very knowledgeable. However, he does not use Canvas and you have to print every assignment. He will only give useful feedback after the submission of each first assignment so expect to receive a bad mark. EXTREMELY hard marking. Can be arrogant at times and made the class harder than it needed to be.

This class is really hard but probably the most informative and impactful business course I've taken at SFU so far. It transformed my writing skills. The class is project and assignment based, we did memo's, letters, and a group presentation at the end of the semester. Grading is tough but the class is worth it.
His assignments are organized and not hard but his grading is. Porfolio is easy mark. Overall, I like his course grading, very simple and easy to keep track.

360W is a difficult class but Kevin made it more difficult by not using Canvas. Everything was emailed and had to be printed out so it was extremely unorganized. Considering the amount we had to hand in, this was terrible for the environment. Kevin gave contradictory answers to questions which would lose you marks. Lectures were straightforward.
You could follow the exact instructions he gives you and he'll still somehow find a way to ruin your grade. He's very knowledgeable but the grading is absurd
He can be a very unreasonable marker at times but he's very knowledgeable and gives lots of useful feedback. I'd recommend taking 360 with him.

Kevin is the best professor for Bus 360W at SFU. Before taking this course - I remember people saying that he's a tough grader but I'd say he makes his students work smart and improve the writing skills up to great extent. His way of teaching is great and I'd highly suggest everyone to take the class with him.

Excellent feedback on assignment as he goes in great depth to explain things for you. Very professional and everyone can learn lots from him. He speaks on personal business experiences which are easy to remember and apply to your life. The group projects are extremely hard so work closely with him/TA/and your group. Teamwork and detail is crucial.

Kevin is extremely harsh when it comes to grading. I do admit that his feedback can be very detailed & helpful, but ruthless. He tends to remove full letter grades for the smallest of mistakes. If we asked him questions then he'd just comment that we should know it from the course materials. He only taught us through his 5 mins weekly youtube vids.
Notorious BUS 360W class, recommend avoiding if at all possible!

Kevin is a good instructor as he always provides good feedback for students. He is also responsive to emails. However, he is extremely tough and harsh on grading stuff even though in an online class setting. It is hard to access him directly for clarifying the feedback and ask for help. Generally speaking, take other prof for this course.

One of the worst professors I've ever had. When he grades, he's not open towards hearing our opinion or perspective and doesn't come from a place of understanding. He's also very stuck up and not understanding of students' situations. If I were you, I would not take this class, and try to avoid him in general.
Kevin will destroy your hopes, dreams, and everything you love

A difficult prof due to his overly critical grading. He is responsive to emails but will take off full letter grades for tiny mistakes and is unlikely to budge on his opinions of one's mark. Avoid if you can.
Nothing good to say about this prof.

Kevin is a great lecturer. His lectures are interesting and cover important material. The first submissions are graded very hard but he directs you clearly to understand what is expected in the second submission. Although there is a lot to learn and you can possibly recover your grade, it was emotionally challenging to cope with the grading.

Kevin's class was absolutely amazing and I learned so much from his class. Office hour sessions were extremely useful and helped me write memos much more effectively. Although he is a tough grader, his feedback is very clear and detailed. Overall Kevin was an excellent mentor for me and I strongly recommend him in the future.

Kevin is a good lecturer but an incredibly tough marker. He gives detailed feedback on the 1st submission of assignments to help you get to an A level on the 2nd submission; however, you will likely fail the 1st submission because his instructions are subjective/unclear and he is looking for very specific/concise detail. See TA weekly to get a B.

I've never had a professor that spends so much time giving thorough feedback. BUS 360W is much more manageable than people claim. Read his survival guides carefully, take detailed notes in class, follow instructions, use grammarly, and visit his office hours. Kevin is a great prof who is super experienced and genuinely wants to help students.

Kevin is a great lecturer. He is also a ruthless marker. Expectations for his assignments in 360W can be extremely unclear. Visiting his office hours consistently will be the difference maker. Time management with the group project is also essential.

BUS 360 is a course that already is not easy but Kevin is an excellent prof for this course. As he is a consultant for business communications in Vancouver, he brings in real-life cases that he has come across. His feedback on your work is very very thorough so if you want a good mark in his class, make sure you follow and adhere to them.
If you're an average joe like me, you're going to do bad in BUS 360. Might as well take it with the most insightful and feedback-heavy professor there is at SFU.

Good chance that no matter who you take this class with, you will do worse than you expect. Kevin is knowledgeable and the material he taught will be one of the few things I'll remember after I graduate. A tough course, there are little tricks on his individual assignments. Catch them and it'll make the difference of failing or getting a C.

Kevin was an excellent prof. He genuinely cared about his students & was very clear on his expectations for assignments. This class is lots of work, but not as difficult as it is made out to be if you are willing to put the time in & focus on the details. Also, your team makes all the difference. I would definitely recommend taking Kevin for 360W.

Kevin and his teaching team were fantastic throughout the semester. Visit his office hours BEFORE you hand in Memo and Letter submission 1. You will either fail or scrape by with a C otherwise. Be prepared to work hard with your team. REVISE, REVISE, REVISE. Office hours are your friend.  You will learn so much with Kevin. Truly outstanding man.

Kevin is a great prof and the feedback he gives is very helpful for future assignments. Hope that you get a good group because this will account for 40% of your grade. Take into account everything he tells you and be meticulous when reviewing. Go to office hours as this will help.

This class is not an easy class for sure. There are weekly portfolios to be done and trust me when I say that you need to revise your exercise weekly. Definitely go see him during his office hours, and also use the TA. I would usually go see kevin 1st and then go see the TA after I revised it according to kevin's comment, I would go see the TA

Very engaging and inspirational.  He is a very tough marker.  I found his marking inconsistent between students which was frustrating.  Overall I learned so much from him and this course - would highly recommend taking Bus 360W with him.  Be prepared for long hours spent on this course.
Loved Kevin! He's paper revisions are minimal (only 1) and he is really great to take the class with!

Myself and my other group members included all managed to get an A in Kevin's class. It's incredibly easy. I thought being an international student would make it difficult. He tells you have to succeed in his class which is great, thank you for the great term Kevin.

BUS360 itself is hard to get a B. However, it is possible in Kevin's class if you work hard. Kevin's instruction is clear and useful that you will learn, improve and apply his techniques to the real-life business writings. Find his help during his office hour!

This is a tough class but Kevin Stewart brings a lot of real world experience and will actually teach you a lot. Just take a lighter course load and put in the time to see him in office hours and you will do better than I did.

Extremely friendly & respectful prof. Treats international & local students the same. Things he teaches are super practical and useful in daily life because he runs a business consulting firm! GO TO HIS OFFICE HOURS!! He will provide help with revision exercises. Put efforts in student profile exercise because he uses it to put you into groups.

I think I did better than my peers because I actually asked him questions about my work (he was very helpful). BUT this course is hella hard, often people get owned on small details, but also very useful. I think he was OK but would feel different I failed.
Worst Prof I have ever had. I am pretty sure he takes pleasure in the suffering he inflicts on students.
Kevin is a great prof. His marking is harsh, but he makes himself very clear. you will learn a lot from his class. be prepare to work a lot in this class.

What I don't understand is if I'm being marked on the absence or presence of one detail (eg. specifying the date), why is that not specified in class so you won't make that mistake? Hoping everyone is going to pass...
Good at getting his point across, but rubbish at getting how much work 3rd and 4th year students have and accomodating to that!

I stood in lines for hours to get into office hour, and he hardly helps. Go see the TA. I didnt buy the textbook, got a "B". But he/TA marks so hard. Our group spent countless hours on our project and ended up just a B. I wouldn't recommend it. I must admit I did learn a lot, like paying attention to detail. I would recommend Christian instead.

The course lives up to its reputation of being tough. Kevin Stewart tries to help his students in any way that he can, and I thought it was evident. I didn't end up doing as well as I had hoped, but I still learned a lot in this course. I would definitely recommend Kevin to other students.

Seemed fair at first as individual asmts like Portfolio were graded fairly(at least for me,but some of my friends got much worse grades even though their work looked almost equally good)BUT HE SCREWED US ON THE GROUP PART!IMAGINE GETTING F AFTER WEEKS OF WORK ON THE REPORT!Take it with Christian bcuz I've heard that he scales grades to some extent.

Kevin is a great prof. People have said he's condescending, he's not at all. He's a really fair marker. He gives you the criteria for all assignments, and if you follow it, you'll do well on them. Awesome prof. I would recommend him over other 360 profs.

I didn't feel he has any attitude toward his students..at least not me anyways, and keep in mind that I don't speak fluent English, but Kevin's always patient enough to explain things to me. Oh and he cares that you succeed not only in 360 but also in the future!

Kevins instructions are clear. He has a 10 page course outline with everything u need  for the course & he gives instruction sheets for each assignment. As long as you go to his office hours, TA, writing mentors etc you will do great! If you're willing to put the work in and keep his constructive critique in mind, you should get an A in the course.

Amazing professor! makes a 3 hour lecture fun through real examples and jokes. Realizes students have other courses than 360 to worry about so doesn't give ridiculous assignments. Gives great and supportive feedback and overall was a great experience. If you're afraid of 360 take it with Robin cause he is hands down the best professor for the class

Took both BUS 393 and BUS 360W with Robin, and I have got to say, he is an amazing prof. 393 can be a dry course but Robin made 1/4 of that class weighted towards interactive tutorial sessions (based on mini-cases). That being said, the final was long so study hard for it. Robin was very helpful for BUS 360. He wants every student to succeed.
Best professor at Simon Fraser University.

Don't usually write Beedie professors reviews because I've had so many who just didn't care about their students, but Robin was definitely different in a good way. Robin is clear on what you're being graded on and does well to make sure classes are engaging. TA's mark a lot of the work, so be sure to go to office hours.

Robin is an amazing lecturer who cares about his students. I took both BUS 360 and BUS 393 with him and had great experiences. He makes lectures fun to attend and gives relevant real-life examples. He is passionate about teaching and wants his students to do well. Ensure to attend classes, and you will be good to go! Highly recommended!
Great prof who wants his students to learn a lot and do well. Uses a lot of humor in class. His grading scheme is much fairer compared to other 360 profs.

Robin's just the type of guy you'd want to go have a beer and talk about life with after class. Really funny prof that knows his material and gives great examples in class. Only bad thing I could say is that he is a little disorganized, and there is a lack of communication between prof and TA expectations for assignments. Great prof.

Learned a lot from Robin! Marks are fair, mostly depending on your TA as they grade all assignments. It would be best to get help from TA's to know what they are looking for. Robin had 2 sections with different TA's; each had very different expectations, so make sure you see the one who will be marking your work. Great course overall!
Hes dope.

Horrible experience in this class. TA would play games on laptop during office hours and grading was very inconsistent. robin is alright but he needs to be better at choosing TAs to grade assignments.. got a poor grade because of a poor group and unclear expectations. find out who the TAs are is my tip since i didnt get the other ta

Robin is a very funny person and makes class fly by. Its apparent that he's on the students' side in terms of obtaining a good grade and he wants you to become a better business communicator. TA was Edwin and he was legendary in office hours. Clapped for him in our last class and I think he has been the best TA I've probabl y ever had. Recommend.

Robin is super entertaining that the class doesn't even feel like a 3 hour lecture! He really wants his students to do well and made me become a better writer. However, my TA would take marks off that would contradict what Robin said in lecture.

He's a very good prof. Classes were always interesting and he lets you know what he wants on the assignments. The course is way too much work though and getting in a good group really matters. Edwin is really helpful in office hours. Made a big difference to my mark.

good prof. sometimes may feel like he doesn't care to be there but hes funny and keeps class engaged. ta was edwin and he was very helpful. grading can be subjective but your ta for 360 will be helpful and will explain marking to you.

He's hilarious, keeps the lectures interesting. Eli is my TA, and he's super helpful during office hours. I would recommend taking this class with Robin. You need to go to office hours to get a good grade.
Robin is a great prof. He really wants you to learn to write better and his classes were interesting and practical. My writing got way better during the course.
Words can't describe how awesome he is. I am lucky enough to pass this course with a decent grade for accounting concentration because of him
Glad I took 360 with Robin. Hes a good prof and a nice guy. The course was a lot of work but it wasnt too bad. Go to offixe hours if you want to do well.

Robin is a great prof. Really cool and relaxed. Loves to give stories and swears quite a bit. A lot depends on your TA - I recommend taking it with Edwin Y. He's really helpful in his office hours, super nice, and funny.
Robin is an excellent prof. He knows what he is talking about and gives clear lectures and useful guidance on the assignments. My writing improved a lot during the course. I recommend Robin for 360W.

I was dreading taking 360, but I actually really enjoyed the course. I thought Robin was a very good prof. His lectures were interesting and the grading was fair. I went to TA and Robin's office hours a lot, and found that that made a huge difference. I also had a very good group for our report group, and that helped too.

I expected to find this class painful, but I actually enjoyed it because of Robin. Entertaining lectures, crystal clear grading criteria, and good feedback during office hrs. He tells it like it is, so if you don't have a thick skin or a sense of humour then take 360 with someone boring.

Robin cuts through the crap and gets straight to the point, which is really refreshing. My writing has improved quite a bit. He's extremely helpful during his office hours and genuinely wants you to do well. I would personally compare him with Tyrion Lannister though. Clever, funny, and really cool dude!

Robin is a hilarious prof, and also does his job well. He truly cares about you succeeding and wants it so you don't make any silly mistakes that can plague you in the real world. He's almost a real life version of Ned Stark. Highly recommend.
Don't take him
Supposed to be one of the better profs, he's really gotten worse :(

I learned a ton with Robin this semester. The course is a lot of work but you actually learn to write better.  Robin is a great lecturer and really funny! He put the grading rubrics on Canvas before the assignments were due, which was really helpful. Pay attention in class and you'll do all right. He tells you what he wants.

Amazing  Prof! He really cares about the course and his lectures are worthwhile. Plus he's really funny.   Robin wants you to write better. And you actually will if you put the work in. Go to office hours, he'll help you get a better mark. The group project really depends on getting a good group. My group was great. The  TA was too.

Amazing prof! He is super chill and laid back and is probably one of the easier 360 profs. Didn't expect to get an A in 360 but I did. He makes the class really manageable, but keep in mind that most of your grade depends on your TA. My TA was awesome as well.
Awesome professor! Teaches 360 in a way that can be easily understood by everyone. Does not have unrealistic expectations of students or of quality of work. Bonus is he is hilarious.

Best Prof I have ever had. I wish I could have taken more classes with him. I failed BUS 360W my first attempt and got a B+ my second attempt with him. He was so understanding and helpful!!! I say this with highest confidence that he genuinely wants you to succeed. I never thought id get a B+ in this class!!!! PS. he should win Funniest Prof Award

I was really scared to take this class, but Robin made BUS 360W bearable. There is a lot of homework, so don't expect to get a good mark if you slack off. My TA was also very helpful and gave great feedback. A large component of the mark is based on group projects, so hopefully you end up with a good group!

I thought he was very clear in rubric, they were not vague. Go to class and take notes on what he wants for the assignments and you'll be fine. He's also quite helpful in office hours.  Course requires work wasn't as bad as I was expecting for 360.

We were put into groups according to our first assignment and that type of grouping is better than random or by diversity. When I was taking the course, I didn't feel like my writing was improving that much, but after a couple months, I can see the results. I write a lot better now. The TA marks most of our stuff. He's an interesting lecturer.

Funny at the beginning... He's never clear on what he expected. Rubrics are vague and subjective. Not a lot of feedback on writing exercises. He grouped us based on the number of mistakes you made on the first portfolio, so you'll stuck with your group-mates through out the entire group project.

Vague & contradictory grading criteria. Lectures were fine but I have never been graded so harshly. It felt like she was actively looking for issues to create with each paper. I went in for office hours and she was very condescending. A revision I did got a worse grade than the original submission. I only passed because I did well on final pres.
My mind was blown by this course. The professor. The lectures. The assignments. The grading. All of it was awful. The worst course I've ever taken 🏆.

Course helped me so much with all the exercises and class discussions. Liked the range of topics and started using right away. Know will use approaches a lot - thanks Leanne for all great feedback and learning!

Best course at Beedie - real examples helped to learn to communicate better and I have used the information every day at work and school. You need to be organized as each week there are assignments. I liked the activities we do so the class goes quickly. Leanne is always ready to help, all you have to do is ask or show up to her office hours.

One of the best profs Ive had in Beedie. The negative reviews are from people who don't pay attention to assignment criteria or the core learning objectives and are upset about their bad grades. She genuinely wants you to succeed and is very understanding and kind. Lectures are engaging (fun too if you have a good class) and the 3 hours go by fast.
Most valuable course taken. Use info all the time. Liked the engaging activities and all the real examples to help me learn.

Leanne is a kind and fair professor. Her 3 hour lectures are very engaging and go by fast. She finds engaging activities, gives us a break, and gets us moving out of our seats. There is a lot of group work so be ready for that and its true that the grading is though but overall I really enjoyed this class and I would recommend taking it with Leanne
Appreciated the engaging classes. Three hours flew by. Learned a lot and have been using this information in my job.  Great feedback and encouraged me to learn and grow.

Shauna is very nice and pretty knowledgable in general. My complaint is that she is sometimes unclear about what she wants to see on assignments and sometimes contradicts herself, or has hidden expectations that aren't on the criteria.

Avoid at all costs. I did not heed the warnings of those before me and paid the price. By far the worst experience I've ever had in a class at SFU and I can take a lot. Take this class with someone else I cannot warn you enough.

Complaining about this class is similar to that of stating your own incompetence. I'm as lazy as can be. However, I managed to do well in Shauna's class by listening to what she wanted and understanding the TA's needs. 360W is a course where you can succeed with minimal effort as long as you understand what needs to be done. A very pleasant class.

The real life case is painful. We are supposed to analyse a company's problem and give them a recommendation. Employees has their degrees, and they reply on the company for income. If they can't come up with useful advises to solve the company's problem, how well do you think you are gonna make a good recommendation? And how well can your grade be?

Strongly recommend you to take someone else's class. She expects you read your whole chapter before class but the lecture is about something else, i.e. the book is kinda not covered in the lecture. She always bring life example into this course which makes it really difficult and massive of work. And these make it harder than it should be.

This class was an incredible amount of work. Large percentage of mark is group work. If your grade is more important to you than most students, be prepared to do most of the work yourself. Our group project was a pilot use of Riipen, which was hard because it didn't align with the  assignment well. Hardest I've worked for any class.
Shauna is probably the best prof to take for 360W. Assignments are clear, and her marking is very fair. You will get A+'s in her class as long as your writing is up to standard!

If you have to take BUS360, take it with Shauna. Although the workload is difficult, she is a great professor who cares and wants you to improve your writing. She gives lots of helpful feedback, is very organized with her rubric, and tends to give less portfolio assignment that other 360 profs.

Shauna's a great professor always willing to help and overall great prof. She is a fair marker and if you get a bad grade, blame that on the course being tough. Put in the time and effort and you'll see results.

Shauna is nice and willing to help you. But the criteria for marking is wired, sometimes you will think it's unfair because she will give high grade to what she has expected, formation is not very important. If you have questions please to ask professor because TA won't tell anything
What efforts you put in = what grade you will receive. Work hard and it will pay back! She is trying her best to help you improve your writing skills.

Teaching notes are not specific enough. Need to see more samples or detail on teaching slides to complete assignments accurately. You get marked down for too little detail and sometimes for too much detail - what are you supposed to do?  Low class average (no surprise there). Ambiguous assignments with incomplete information.
Hard and picky marker; agree with unclear guidelines;improvement needed re: communication sills; not learning how to be a better writer which is the intent of the course but being nit-picked instead

Tough class no matter who you take it with. Do exactly what she says and give her exactly what she wants/asks for down to the smallest detail and will do fine. You do not know better than her. Pretending you do = fail.

I really enjoyed taking BUS360W with Eric. His lectures were interesting and the content itself was interesting. He was always willing to help and gave great feedback during office hours. There are many assignments, but the deadlines are reasonable and fair.
His rating speaks for itself. I would absolutely recommend taking 360W with him. He provides lots of help and is genuinely a nice guy.

Really great prof for BUS 360. Grading expectations are clear, and the feedback is very helpful. There are plenty of opportunities to improve throughout the course. The professor is also very flexible, offering lectures both in person and on Zoom, with the option to do presentations online as well.

Eric has to be one of the chillest professors at Beedie. I got 50% on my first assignment, and he basically coached me all the way to an A. He's a genuinely great guy, and I loved how he went around the class during the breaks to get to know everyone.

Eric is the GOAT!!! He is passionate, funny, and engaging and truly cares about his students. BUS360 is super challenging, with the heaviest workload and demanding writing and analytical tasks. His lectures are interesting.The feedback he provides is constructive and helps you improve significantly. Best and greatest choice for this course

Eric is a great instructor who really cares about his students' improvement. He gives clear feedback and is always open to questions. I made an effort to attend his office hours regularly, and it definitely helped me make progress. The class is well-structured and fair. I'm glad I took this course with him.

Eric is a caring, smart, and funny teacher with practical, real-world knowledge (probably the best 360W lecturer if you want to learn useful business writing skills). Last semester during the TA strike, in which the course is structured to depend on TA feedback, Eric went above and beyond for us, like extra office hours and deadline extensions...

Experience from Fall 2021, so first term back to in person. Anyways, 360W has no curve and really makes you work for your grade, but Eric was very nice and had a zoom call on as well as the in-person session. Clear grading rubrics too, so just follow those. Would recommend!

Eric's teaching style is very straightforward yet relaxed. His lectures are short and to-the-point; I never felt that he was wasting my time. As with all BUS360W classes, assignments are marked harshly. Eric provides lots of resources and clearly outlines his expectations, so it is possible to do well. MAKE SURE TO READ INSTRUCTIONS CAREFULLY!

Heads up - BUS 360 is not a curved class which means you get what you get. This class definitely isn't easy but you do learn lots from the course. Marking is tough but not impossible. Eric is an approachable prof that does his best to help out his students. You'll be working on a group project for most of the semester, so pray for a good group.

I was always sceptical about the high-rated profs but Eric's reviews are the real thing. He is super nice, approachable and wants you to succeed. Despite everything being marked strictly, the marking rubric was available and clear enough to know how to get good mark. I had to wait a semester to take a class with him and it was definitely worth it.

Eric is a great professor to take BUS360W with. His lectures were very concise and straight to the point, which I really appreciated. He provided great feedback for all the deliverables, and was very accommodating during the shift to online learning. Marking was tough, but thats just the nature of the course. Eric was super helpful.

The marking rubrics for his assignments are very inconsistent. His TA is somewhat double standard to my. For example, myself and my group mate both wrote "Email" as the title, however, only one of us was penalized for doing that.

Eric and his TA gave assignments that helped my writing. The grading can feel overwhelming at first (especially after the first exercise). I appreciated the clear expectations - following them is key to doing well.

Although BUS 360W is one of the hardest business courses, Eric Tung has made this course extremely valuable to students by providing constructive feedback on where to improve and clear/concise lectures on business writing. Highly recommend taking this course with him.

Despite failing my first assignment in this course, I was able to succeed for the remainder of the course as Eric provides great feedback and lots of opportunities to improve/revise. For such an intense course, Eric makes the workload manageable and he is understanding of students' needs. I would recommend taking 360 with him.

Definitely one of my favourite profs at sfu, Eric is an approachable, easy going and understanding professor, really enjoyed time in his class. Heard a lot of bad things about this course but Eric made the material very easy to understand

Eric is the best prof at SFU and is super approachable. The assignments were graded fairly and Eric was always available to provide feedback on the assignments. Just make sure you follow all the instructions and the class will be a breeze.

Eric definitely lives up to his reputation. He's a very tough grader and penalizes heavily if you don't follow instructions. Besides that he's an absolute gem. Put in the effort, go to office hrs, pay attention to EVERY detail and reap the rewards. He makes 360 less daunting as most assignments are done in class. Super chill guy too.

Eric is a wonderful teacher that pushes students to excel and improve. He is always available to give feedback so you can improve for next time. All the in-class assignments are open book as he emphasizes learning and applying the knowledge rather than memorizing.
Best prof so far, really chill, helpful, and tolerance

If you have the opportunity to take BUS 360W with Eric Tung, do it. Even though the course is designed to be tedious, Eric made the course load manageable and was approachable when help was needed. The lectures he provided were valuable and applicable in everyday communication. Simply put, he changed the way I communicate verbally, and in writing.

Eric is an amazing and caring instructor, he really does want his students to succeed. The course itself is a lot of work but definitely manageable and Eric makes the course much more enjoyable than what most people say about 360. Highly recommend!

As an international student, I found Eric as an amazing professor. The work load increases gradually as the semester goes by. It is important to have a good group. There are fewe deliverables for the portfolio compared to other 360 sections. If you didn't do well in the first submissions, going to office hours will help a lot to improve your work.

Eric was a really nice professor both in-class and outside of class. There are fewer total deliverables required in comparison to other 360 sections. This made the 4-credit course a lot easier to manage alongside others. Without a doubt, I would take this class again simply for the reduced number of deliverables and personality of professor Tung.
Eric is by far the best 360 prof. He is very approachable and makes the class worth coming too. You will walk out of this class with a whole new perspective towards business writing.
Eric is helpful, approachable, and reasonable. Though BUS 360 is a tough course, I would recommend taking it with him because he provides good feedback.

Eric is one of the best profs I have had at SFU. He is very friendly, approachable and provides great feedback during his office hours. The writing portfolio isn't as time-consuming as it is with other Bus360w professors. Overall I would highly recommend Eric.

Eric is an amazing prof! He is caring and takes the time to go over why you received a particular grade. Overall, the class didn't have a heavy course load. My only tip is to use the Survival Guides he provides and pay attention to the details outlined in it.

Eric is awesome, he is very patient with every student and always available for help. Just go to visit his office hour regularly, your writing skills will improve for sure. This course wasn't as difficult as what I expected it to be, as long as you put in efforts, you can do really well in this course. Thought I will fail this course but I passed!

Eric is very helpful. He is one of my favourite professor in SFU. Eric make BUS 360W easier than expected. Although this course is grade tougher than any other courses, Eric always give useful feedback to let you improve your work.

BUS 360 is a tough course, but Eric makes it a lot easier if you put in the work required to improve your writing. I failed the first 10% of my grade, but made up for it by attending office hours and doing well on the revisions of my work (I am not typically an A student). Eric's office hours are limited each week, but he provides good feedback.

Eric is a great guy, he really takes the time to make sure his students are treated fairly within classes. If you have any questions on grading, you can go see him and he'll give you the rationale behind the grade or even bump it up. On top of this he is more lenient on certain things than other 360 profs. I would definitely recommend Eric for 360.

Eric is one of my favorite professors at SFU. He really cares about his students and wants them to do well.  It is super important to go see him or the TA's in office hours because their feedback is very important for the project and portfolio. But if you take the time to go to office hours, you will have no problems in the course.
Eric is a super helpful person. Go to his office hours for better results!

Take this course, you will not regret. I am a English as Additional Language student. It is clear that I really suck at English. However, Eric actually spent a lot of time on helping me to improve it. Really helpful and good Professor. RECOMMENDED!!

Eric is hands down one of the best profs I've had! He is not only passionate about teaching but also wants his students to succeed in the class. Eric is always wiling to answer questions and provide feedback on our writing. I've learned important business conventions that I can take away from this class and apply to the real world. Great teacher!

Helpful, but is one of those courses where you learn through failure. Nothing of substance covered in class. Class just needs really high language and EQ levels. Eric says its all to simulate the work environment, but i really doubt so. Eric is helpful, but is the strictest grader. Others are less helpful, but also less strict. Take your pick.
BUS360 doesn't actually teach you anything you don't already know. Doesn't even actually teach you HOW to write. Eric is a good teacher. I just think that the course is pointless.
Eric is a great proff. He will give you feedback and ways to improve your writing assignments if you go see him during office hours and he will stay after class to answer any questions you have.
Eric is awesome!  Good lecturer and gives detailed feedbacks.  However, his grading style is quite strict and don't be surprised if you receive a D on some of the assignments

One of the best instructors I have had at SFU. He cares about his students and wants them to do well. Because he has his own company and is actively involved in the business world, he understands what Business writing really is, and how to actually apply it. 350 characters is not enough to describe how awesome he is, so just take my word for it.
He is cool

I HIGHLY recommend taking Eric Tung for BUS 360W. Specifically for the following reasons: the marking is clear, expectations are set from the beginning of the course and provides the resources for you to be successful, he is very helpful and attentive to any questions/concerns, and he is a genuinely good person who wants you to succeed.

Eric is a very supportive and understanding professor. The course itself is not easy. However, with the help of Eric's feedback and comments, it is easier to improve and write better next time. Eric is also my role model and inspiration and he is more than willing to help students succeed if you put effort and time.
Best professor!

Eric is a very good instructor and a role model - clear, respectful, and approachable. He was always quick to respond to e-mails, and was willing to help students succeed.  Be sure to attend classes, proof read meticulously, and put in the best effort; what you get out of this class will be more valuable than just a good grade.

Eric's class was prepared and organized. He makes his instructions, comments and feedback very clear and easy to follow. In addition, he is approachable and helpful as he reply students' email quickly and he was willing to provide extra office hour for students. I would recommend him to anybody who want to improve their business writing.
Eric is a great prof, great person. Recommending take his class.
He's one of the best profs I have had at sfu, very helpful, learn a lot.
Eric is such a great prof who is always there to help you and knows how to respect students as a learner. Maybe that's why his class is filled up so fast.
Eric gives real life examples from his job outside of SFU. Attend his office hours with specific questions in order to get feedback. He is helpful.

Eric is a very helpful lecturer. He gives genuine and clear guidance and feedback on individual assignments and group projects, which make this challenging course less intimidating. Having that said, serious effort is still required to get a B or above. Half-assed work done 30 minutes before the submission deadline will definitely hurt your grade.

Professor Gibson taught 309W like a boss. Sure, the grading in this course is rough but the concepts she teaches helps students become a better writer. Her lectures are hilarious and relatable, but be ready to follow instructions and put in the work. Your ethos will thank you for taking this course!

She is very interested and passionate about writing and the course, however she can get defensive if you question grading, comments, or instructions. Though it is hard to access her for office hours (because everyone wants to go to them!), but you should go for individual or group feedback- it will help your grades.
